qas.question: What happened to the Western Alps during the Cenozoic Era
When did the Austroalpine peaks undergo their event?
The Western Alps and the Austroalpine peaks show distinct differences in what?
When did Flysch deposits probably occur in the Southern Alps of Lombardy?

context: According to <a0_0>geologist<a0_0/> Stefan Schmid, because the Western Alps underwent <a1_0>a metamorphic event<a1_0/> in the Cenozoic Era while the Austroalpine peaks underwent an event in <a2_0>the Cretaceous Period<a2_0/>, the two areas show distinct differences in <a3_0>nappe formations<a3_0/>. Flysch deposits in the Southern Alps of Lombardy probably occurred in the <a4_0>Cretaceous<a4_0/> or later.
